title: Install OO Workflow Designer
content:
This topic contains instructions on how to install an OO Workflow Designer on Windows and Linux environments.

The installation of an OO Workflow Designer is optional.

Prerequisites

Before you begin, make sure you have downloaded and extracted the installation package (installer-designer-<OS>-<latest_version>.zip) onto your local file system.

  • Contact your administrator for the installation package, or
  • Download the installation package from the product user interface. 

Installation instructions

  1. To start the installer:
    On Windows: Right-click the installer-oo-designer-win64-<version>-MT.exe installation file and run it as an administrator.
    On Linux: Run the following command from a Linux terminal window: bash installer-oo-designer-linux-<version>-MT.bin
  2. After you start the installer, the installation package extracts, and the OpenText Operations Orchestration Designer Installation Wizard automatically opens.

  3. On the License page, select I Agree and click Next.

  4. On the Location page, select the location for the installation root directory and click Next. If the directory doesn't exist, the directory gets created automatically. If prompted, confirm the creation of the new location.
    Valid characters for the installation path include English letters, digits, spaces, hyphens (-), and underscores (_).
    The default path for Windows and Linux is:
    Windows: C:\Program Files\Micro Focus\Operations Orchestration Designer
    Linux: /opt/microfocus/oo-designer

  5. On the Options Selection page, select the Operations Orchestration Designer check box and click Next.

  6. On the Connectivity page, configure the OO Workflow Designer ports and TLS.

  7. The HTTPS text box defaults to 8445 value. Change the port details, if required. A recommended option as it enhances security by encrypting the communication channel.

  8. Select Provide a secure TLS certificate, then click Browse to select the certificate. Recommended for security reasons. If you don't select it, the TLS certificate uses a self-signed certificate.
    Don't use a network path for the CA root certificate location.
    Configuring at least one port is mandatory. If a port isn't defined, or if the ports are occupied by other applications, you won't be able to complete the installation. 
    To configure TLS communication with PostgreSQL server, see Configure TLS on PostgreSQL.

  9. If you select a TLS certificate, enter its password twice for confirmation.

  10. Click Browse to specify the location of the CA root certificate to import into the TrustStore for OO Workflow Designer.
    Don't use a network path for the location of the CA root certificate.

  11. (Optional) Enter the LWSSO initialization string under LW-SSO init string. This must be the same LW-SSO initialization string that's used by the embedding application, must be at least 32 characters, and must contain lowercase, uppercase, and numeric letters.

  12. Click Show passwords to view the entered password.

  13. Click Test ports availability. If the ports are available, a Success checkmark appears.
    In case of an error, adjust the ports and try again.
    If the Success checkmark appears, click Next.

    The Python Executor will install on the default port for Workflow Designer (8003). If the port is already in use, when the port availability is checked, a new section with the Python Executor port will display allowing you to change the port with a valid one.
    Please note that after changing the port you need to click the Test ports availability button again to validate the new port.

  14. On the Identity Management Configuration page, choose one of the following options:
    Create a new IdM service: If you want to create a new IdM management service.
    Connect to an existing IdM service: If you already have an existing IdM management service On-Premise.

  15. If you selected the Create IdM service option, enter the appropriate details for the corresponding sections displayed.

    Name of the section Field name and description
    IdM Configuration

    Hostname: Enter the hostname of the IdM service. 

    Tenant: Enter the value of the tenant in the IdM service. The default value is OO.

    Signing Key: Automatically generated. However, you can change it, and it must contain lower case, upper case, digits, and special characters of at least 32 characters long.
    OO Designer Credentials

    IdM Administrator Username: Your IdM service administrator username. The default value is administrator, you can change it per your choice.
    The default user is the administrator for a first time installation. For upgrades, use the user set up in the previous version of the application.

    IdM Administrator Password: Your IdM service administrator password

    IdM Transport Username: Your IdM REST integration username

    IdM Transport Password: Your IdM REST integration password
    The IdM Transport User and IdM Transport Password don't respect password policy requirements. You must ensure that the password is of at least 8 characters and must contain lowercase, uppercase, digits, and special characters.

  16. Select the Show passwords check box if you want to view the passwords.

  17. Select the Save the passwords to a file check box, if you wish to save the information on this screen to a file. If you select the check box, browse and select a file to save the information from this page. The default IdM transport user and IdM transport password are also saved in this file (idm.configuration.username and idm.configuration.password).

  18. Click Next to continue with the Connectivity page from Step 26 (On the IdM Database Configuration page).

    If you select Connect to an existing IdM service option, then enter appropriate details for the corresponding sections displayed. A new link to IdM Admin gets added in the standalone OO Workflow Designer after installation. The administrator can create new database users.

    Name of the section Field name and description
    IdM service details

    IdM URL: Enter the URL (FQDN or IP address) of the IdM service. For example, <idm_protocol>://<idm_hostname>:<idm_port>/<idm_service_path>

    IdM Transport Username: Your IdM service username

    IdM Transport Password: Your IdM service password

    Signing Key: The signing key must be at least 32 characters and must contain lower case, upper case, digits, and special characters.
    Tenant credentials

    Tenant: The name of the OO tenant is auto populated. Default is OO.

    IdM Administrator Username: The default user, administrator, is automatically populated. This user has full access to the IdM database.

    IdM Administrator Password: Your IdM service administrator password

    Click Test Connection to test the connection. If successful, click Next to continue with the Connectivity page from Step 26 (On the IdM Database Configuration page).

  19. On the Designer Database Configuration page, you can configure and create the database schema. From the Database Type list, select the database vendor, and then enter the connection properties.

  20. If you select the Connect to existing database/schema option, the installer verifies that the schema/database and user exist. It's recommended to not use administrative user accounts in the Username and Password fields because this will install OO Workflow Designer under the administrative account.

  21. You can then select from the following database types:

    Database Fields
    Oracle Database

    JDBC Driver jar: Select the path of the downloaded Oracle JDBC driver jar file as part of your installation prerequisite task.

    Hostname or IP address: Enter the hostname or IP address of the VM that has the database.

    Port: The connection port for the Oracle database gets selected by default.

    SID or Service Name: Select either of the two and then enter the SID or service name of the database.

    It's recommended to use the Oracle database's service name rather than using the SID. 

    Username: Enter the username to connect with the Oracle database that you created.

    Password: Enter the password to connect with the Oracle database that you created.
    Microsoft SQL Server

    Hostname or IP address: Enter the hostname or IP address of the VM that has the database.

    Port: The connection port for the database gets selected by default.

    Database: Enter the name of the database.

    Username: Enter the username to connect with the Microsoft SQL Server database that you created.

    Password: Enter the password to connect with the Microsoft SQL Server database that you created.
    PostgreSQL

    Hostname or IP address: Enter the hostname or IP address of the VM that has the database.

    Port: The connection port for the database gets selected by default.

    Database: Enter the name of the database.

    Username: Enter the username to connect with the PostgreSQL database that you created.

    Password: Enter the password to connect with the PostgreSQL database that you created.
    Other databases

    JDBC Driver jar: Select the path of the downloaded Oracle JDBC driver jar file as part of your installation prerequisite task

    JDBC Driver class name: Enter the class name of the JDBC driver.

    JDBC URL: Enter the JDBC URL.

    Username: Enter the username to connect with the Oracle database that you created.

    Password: Enter the password to connect with the Oracle database that you created.

  22. When you choose the Create the database/schema option, it lets you create a new database or schema.

    You can then select from the following database types:

    Database type Description
    Oracle Don't use SYS, SYSTEM, or other administrative account credentials in the Username and Password fields.
    Microsoft SQL Server Don't use sa or other administrative account credentials in the Username and Password fields. If you are installing OO Workflow Designer with Oracle RAC (Real Application Cluster), you must choose the Other database and give the URL.
    PostgreSQL Don't use the PostgreSQL credential in the username and Password fields. You may note that PostgreSQL database names are case-sensitive. You may note that PostgreSQL database names are case-sensitive.
    Database Fields
    Oracle database

    JDBC Driver jar: Select the path of the downloaded Oracle JDBC driver jar file.

    Hostname or IP address: Enter the hostname or IP address of the VM that has the database.

    Port: The connection port for the Oracle database appears by default.

    SID or Service Name: Select either of the two and then enter the SID or service name of the database.

    It's recommended to use the Oracle database's service name rather than using the SID.

    Username: Enter the username to connect with the Oracle database that you created.

    Password: Enter the password to connect with the Oracle database that you created.

    DBA Username: Enter the username to connect with the Oracle database that you created.

    DBA Password: Enter the password to connect with the Oracle database that you created. This elevated privileges user must be able to connect to the database and create the new schema, user, or database for Operations Orchestration.

    Tablespace: Enter the Oracle data file table space path.

    Temporary table space: Enter the Oracle Temporary table space path.
    Microsoft SQL Server

    Hostname or IP address: Enter the hostname or IP address of the VM that has the database.

    Port: The connection port for the database appears by default.

    Database: Enter the name of the database.

    Username: Enter the username to connect with the Microsoft SQL Server database that you created.

    Password: Enter the password to connect with the Microsoft SQL Server database that you created.

    Ensure to enter the password that complies with the Microsoft SQL Server password policy requirements to prevent installation failure.  

    Admin Username: Enter the administrator username to connect with the Microsoft SQL Server database.

    Admin Password: Enter the administrator password to connect with the Microsoft SQL Server database.
    PostgreSQL

    Hostname or IP address: Enter the hostname or IP address of the VM that has the database.

    Port: The connection port for the database appears by default.

    Database: Enter the name of the database.

    Username: Enter the username to connect with the PostgreSQL database that you created.

    Password: Enter the password to connect with the PostgreSQL database that you created.

    Admin Username: Enter the administrator username to connect with the PostgreSQL database.

    Admin Password: Enter the administrator password to connect with the PostgreSQL database.

  23. Click Test Connection. If you are unable to connect to the database, you won't be able to proceed to the next steps in the wizard.

    If your password isn't strong enough, a warning message appears. You will still be able to proceed with the installation, but it's strongly recommended to replace it with a stronger password.

    The installer checks for NON EMPTY schemas/databases, and shows a warning message if the schema or database isn't empty. If the installation fails during schema validation, the installation process stops.

  24. Select I Agree to assume associated risks if you are using non-TLS communication.

  25. On the IdM Database Configuration page, either Connect to an existing database/schema or Create the database/schema option appears depending on your selection on the Designer Database Configuration page. Enter appropriate values: 
    If you had selected MS SQL as the database type previously, you must set the Database COLLATION to CASE INSENSITIVE (Example: SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS) and then run the following queries 
to set the snapshot isolation and read committed snapshot flags to true. 

ALTER DATABASE <DB_NAME> 
SET ALLOW_SNAPSHOT_ISOLATION ON 

ALTER DATABASE <DB_NAME> 
SET READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT ON
  26.  If you had selected Connect to an existing database/schema, enter valid values for the following fields: 
    Field Description
    IdM Database Hostname This field is auto filled from the OO Designer database screen.
    Port This field is auto filled from the OO Designer database screen.
    IdM Database Name Enter the name of the IdM Database.
    IdM Database Username Enter the username of the IdM Database.
    IdM Database Password Enter the password of the IdM Database.
  27. If you had selected Create the database/schema, enter valid values for the following fields:
    Field Description
    IdM Database Hostname This field is auto filled from the OO Designer Database screen.
    Port This field is auto filled from the OO Designer Database screen.
    IdM Database Name Enter the name of the IdM Database.
    IdM Database Username Enter the username of the IdM Database.
    IdM Database Password Enter the password of the IdM Database.
    Admin Username Enter the administrator username.
    Admin Password Enter the administrator password.
  28. Click Test Connection to test the connection. If successful, click Next.
    The IdM database that you are configuring must be empty. Otherwise, a warning message appears when testing the connection.

  29. On the Language step, select a supported language for OO Workflow Designer, in addition to English, if required, and then click Next.
    OO Workflow Designer is available in the following languages: English, French, German, Japanese, Simplified Chinese, and Spanish.

  30. The Summary page displays the installation and configuration settings you selected and entered in the wizard. Check that the settings are correct. If you want to correct one of the items, click Back.

  31. Click Install. The installation begins, and the wizard displays a check mark next to each successfully installed item on the Installation and Configuration Progress page.
    If there is a problem with one of the installations or configured items, the installation attempts to continue with the rest of the items regardless of that error. You can open the installer.log file to check for errors. The default location is C:\Program Files\Micro Focus\Operations Orchestration Designer for Windows and /opt/microfocus/oo-designer for Linux.

  32. When the installation is complete, click Next.
  33. Click Finish to close the Installation and Configuration wizard.
  34. Access the OO Designer by logging into: https://<OODesignerHost>:<port>/oo-designer with the administrator account you created in Step 15 (On the Identity Management Configuration page).
    If you aren't sure about the host or port, you can look for the same in the designer-wrapper.conf file inside the OO Designer installation folder: wrapper.java.additional.<>=-Dmgmt.url=https://OODesignerHost:<port>/oo-designer.
